item.title: Sensex Dips 0.44% Amid Broad Market Weakness; Realty Sector Leads Losses
item.description: Indian equity markets closed lower on 12 Jan 2026, with the Sensex falling 0.44% to 83,205.86 amid widespread selling pressure. Market breadth was notably weak, reflecting cautious investor sentiment as only 7 of 37 sectors advanced. Realty stocks led the declines, while metal shares provided some respite. Foreign institutional investors remained net sellers, adding to the subdued mood. Time: 13 minutes ago

item.title: Eternal Ltd’s Nifty 50 Membership Highlights Institutional Shifts and Market Impact
item.description: Eternal Ltd, a prominent constituent of the Nifty 50 index and a major player in the E-Retail sector, has recently been downgraded from a Hold to a Sell rating, reflecting growing concerns over its valuation and recent performance trends. Despite its impressive long-term returns, the stock’s short-term momentum and institutional interest have shown signs of strain, raising questions about its near-term outlook within the benchmark index framework. Time: 16 minutes ago
